results.title: Introduction to Yoga
results.brief_description: In this video, especially made for beginners, Laliita Gilbert shows us: breathing, standing exercises, relaxation techniques. This highly instructive video introduces the viewer to the benefits of the essential philosophy and preparatory techniques of yoga.

results.title: Kismet
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Kismet is an enchanting musical filled with sensual dance and magical song. Howard Keel plays the witty poet-beggar whose quick tongue is forever getting him in trouble…and out again. Masquerading as Hajj, a famous sorcerer with magic powers, he has just the right amount of charm to turn a fair lady’s head, a fair lady who happens to be the Wazir’s Number One Wife! Cast also includes Ann Blyth, Dolores Grey, Vic Damone.

results.title: The Spiral Staircase
results.creator_credit: Robert Siodmak, Dore Schary and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: The spiral staircase is a thriller with chilling developments. It set a standard by which other classic thrillers may be judged. A small town in 1906 New England is terrorised by a psychopathic killer of deformed girls. Based on the novel “Some must watch” by Ethel Lina White. Stars Dorothy McGuire, George Brent, Kent Smith and Ethel Barrymore.

results.title: Indiscreet
results.brief_description: A NATO officer meets a beautiful actress and falls in love with her, but protects himself by saying he is married. The script of this film was written by Norman Krasna, based on his play “Kind Sir”. It stars Cary Grant and Ingrid Bergman.

results.title: And now for something completely different
results.creator_credit: Ian Macnaughton, Patricia Casey and Python Productions
results.brief_description: Monty Python’s Flying Circus strikes again in this hilarious anthology of the funniest sketches from the legendary BBC television series starring John Cleese, Graham Chapman, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Michael Palin.

results.title: Threshold of liberty
results.creator_credit: David Richardson, Lorna Pegram, BBC and RM Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Shock of the New Series”.
The desire for absolute freedom appeared aesthetically as Surrealism where the mystery and melancholy of dreams could renew art and life, producing strange encounters between objects. The Surrealists, traitors to the Bourgeoisie, admirers of de Sade, preached supremacy of desire. However, they were soon absorbed into ‘chic’, and became what they had originally set out to reject - a style.

results.title: Swing time
results.creator_credit: George Stevens, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Swing time was the sixth film made by Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers together. The story is slight, but quite delightful, bringing Fred and Ginger together, then keeping them apart until the last time we hear “A fine romance”. Astaire plays a dancer out of work, and Rogers is a dancing teacher - he pretends that he cannot dance so that he may be taught by Rogers.

results.title: Democracy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lasswell and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This is a companion film for use with the film “Despotism”. It gives a short abstract treatment of the meaning of the word, “democracy”, showing that two of the historical conditions essential for the existence of democracy are a balanced economic distribution and an enlightened population, which in turn produce two of the abstract characteristics of democracy - shared respect and shared power.

results.title: The World: A Television History. Ep. 08. Islam
results.creator_credit: David Wright, Bricomin Films, Channel Four, Goldcrest TV and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The World: A Television History”.
This episode looks at the development of Islam over the period AD 600 - 1200. In the 6th century, a Prophet called Mohamed was born in Mecca and later travelled to Medina where he established the first Muslim state and built the first mosque. By the 9th century, Muslims had established a house of science in Baghdad, and during the 10th, 11th and 12th centuries Islamic art and culture evolved. There are now over 600 million Muslims, accounting for 1/7 of the total population of the world. Based on The Times atlas of world history.

results.title: Noi Tre
results.creator_credit: Pupi Avati, Antonio Avati, Duea Film, Istituto Luce Italnoleggio Cinematografico and Rai Uno Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: One of the most delightful films ever made about Mozart, “Noi Tre” is also a delicate and touching study of the last moments of childhood, as the 14 year old prodigy spends summer with his father on Count Pallavicini’s estate preparing for an important exam at the Bologna Philharmonic Academy. However, in between his studies he falls in with the local boys of his own age, and also feels the first stirring’s of love for Antonia, a girl from a nearby villa. Tasting for the first time, the life of a normal 14 year old, Mozart decides to fail the exam.
